pullrequest.title: Added an IndexedMzML class to make random access of indexed MzML documents possible.

content.raw:
Hi!

This looks very interesting, although I don't have the time to read it all carefully right now.
The idea of storing byte offsets has floated around for a while, but no one got around to implementing it before.
My main question (sorry if it's obvious, my mind is mostly occupied with stuff I need to be doing now) is why do we have to use regex?
Another thing I noticed is that your `read_from_start` is very similar to the `auxiliary._keepstate` decorator, maybe we can reuse it?
Finally, do you think this could be generalized onto the XML class instead of mzML? `get_by_id`, for example, is mostly used in `mzid`.

Thank you and best regards.
content.html:
Hi!

This looks very interesting, although I don't have the time to read it all carefully right now. The idea of storing byte offsets has floated around for a while, but no one got around to implementing it before. My main question (sorry if it's obvious, my mind is mostly occupied with stuff I need to be doing now) is why do we have to use regex? Another thing I noticed is that your read_from_start is very similar to the auxiliary._keepstate decorator, maybe we can reuse it? Finally, do you think this could be generalized onto the XML class instead of mzML? get_by_id, for example, is mostly used in mzid.

Thank you and best regards.
